trustfund:
TF037202-YEMEN - FISHERIES IV,TF035586-MOROCCO - FISHERIES PROJECT AND
            GENERAL SECTOR WORKS,TF028316-GEF1-JORDAN GULF OF AQABA ENV.
            ACTION PLAN

abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Jordan - Gulf of
            Aqaba Environmental Action Plan Project was satisfactory,
            the sustainability was highly likely, the institutional
            development impact was high and, the Bank and borrower
            performance were both satisfactory. The lessons learned
            during the implementation indicated that the goals and
            objectives agreed amongst the stakeholders were clearly
            defined, using a participatory approach of all stakeholders,
            including the local population. In the project design, the
            function of the project manager called for international
            expertise and experience in stat-of-the-art coastal zone
            management to transfer knowledge to the country. Strong
            stakeholder commitment and positive economic returns can
            flow from investment in environmentally sound projects. The
            project also demonstrated how demand driven interventions
            based on an effective environmental by-laws framework with
            stakeholder participation, can bring about effective
            management on the environment through the active involvement
            of all stakeholders. On-the-job training and motivational
            tools contributed to the full integration of the managerial
            and operational project. Well designed cost recovery
            mechanisms will help to ensure financial sustainability.
            Initiating a dialogue with polluters will bring about a
            consensus and lead to solutions.
